section_title: Title and extent of operation of the Code
section_text: This Act shall be called the Indian Penal Code, and shall take effect throughout India except in the territories which, immediately before the 1st day of November, 1956, were comprised in Part B States.
searchable_text: 1 title and extent of operation of the code this act shall be called the indian penal code, and shall take effect throughout india except in the territories which, immediately before the 1st day of november, 1956, were comprised in part b states. indian penal code ipc

section_title: Punishment of offences committed within India
section_text: Every person shall be liable to punishment under this Code and not otherwise for every act or omission contrary to the provisions thereof, of which he shall be guilty within India.
searchable_text: 2 punishment of offences committed within india every person shall be liable to punishment under this code and not otherwise for every act or omission contrary to the provisions thereof, of which he shall be guilty within india. indian penal code ipc

section_title: Punishment of offences committed beyond, but which by law may be tried within, India
section_text: Any person liable, by any Indian law, to be tried for an offence committed beyond India shall be dealt with according to the provisions of this Code for any act committed beyond India in the same manner as if such act had been committed within India.
searchable_text: 3 punishment of offences committed beyond, but which by law may be tried within, india any person liable, by any indian law, to be tried for an offence committed beyond india shall be dealt with according to the provisions of this code for any act committed beyond india in the same manner as if such act had been committed within india. indian penal code ipc

section_title: Extension of Code to extra-territorial offences
section_text: The provisions of this Code apply also to any offence committed by any citizen of India in any place without and beyond India; any person on any ship or aircraft registered in India wherever it may be.
searchable_text: 4 extension of code to extra-territorial offences the provisions of this code apply also to any offence committed by any citizen of india in any place without and beyond india; any person on any ship or aircraft registered in india wherever it may be. indian penal code ipc

section_title: Certain laws not to be affected by this Act
section_text: Nothing in this Act shall affect the provisions of any Act for punishing mutiny and desertion of officers, soldiers, sailors or airmen in the service of the Government of India or the provisions of any special or local law.
searchable_text: 5 certain laws not to be affected by this act nothing in this act shall affect the provisions of any act for punishing mutiny and desertion of officers, soldiers, sailors or airmen in the service of the government of india or the provisions of any special or local law. indian penal code ipc

section_title: Definitions in the Code to be understood subject to exceptions
section_text: Throughout this Code every definition of an offence, every penal provision, and every illustration of every such definition or penal provision, shall be understood subject to the exceptions contained in the Chapter entitled "General Exceptions", though those exceptions are not repeated in such definition, penal provision, or illustration.
searchable_text: 6 definitions in the code to be understood subject to exceptions throughout this code every definition of an offence, every penal provision, and every illustration of every such definition or penal provision, shall be understood subject to the exceptions contained in the chapter entitled "general exceptions", though those exceptions are not repeated in such definition, penal provision, or illustration. indian penal code ipc

section_text: Every expression which is explained in any part of this Code, is used in every part of this Code in conformity with the explanation.
searchable_text: 7 sense of expression once explained every expression which is explained in any part of this code, is used in every part of this code in conformity with the explanation. indian penal code ipc

section_text: The pronoun "he" and its derivatives are used of any person, whether male or female.
searchable_text: 8 gender the pronoun "he" and its derivatives are used of any person, whether male or female. indian penal code ipc

section_text: Unless the contrary appears from the context, words importing the singular number include the plural number, and vice versa.
searchable_text: 9 number unless the contrary appears from the context, words importing the singular number include the plural number, and vice versa. indian penal code ipc

section_text: The word "man" denotes a male human being of any age; the word "woman" denotes a female human being of any age.
searchable_text: 10 "man" and "woman" the word "man" denotes a male human being of any age; the word "woman" denotes a female human being of any age. indian penal code ipc

section_text: Whoever, intending to take dishonestly any movable property out of the possession of any person without that person's consent, moves that property in order to such taking, is said to commit theft. Explanation 1: A thing so long as it is attached to the earth, not being movable property, is not the subject of theft; but it becomes capable of being the subject of theft as soon as it is severed from the earth.

section_text: Whoever commits theft shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.
punishment: shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years,

section_text: Whoever commits theft in any building, tent or vessel, which building, tent or vessel is used as a human dwelling, or for the custody of property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.
punishment: shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years,

section_text: In all robbery there is either theft or extortion. When theft is robbery: Theft is "robbery" if, in order to the committing of the theft, or in committing the theft, or in carrying away or attempting to carry away property obtained by the theft, the offender, for that end, voluntarily causes or attempts to cause to any person death or hurt or wrongful restraint, or fear of instant death or of instant hurt, or of instant wrongful restraint.

section_text: Whoever commits robbery shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine; and, if the robbery be committed on the highway between sunset and sunrise, the imprisonment may be extended to fourteen years.
punishment: shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years,

section_text: Whoever attempts to commit robbery shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.
punishment: shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years,

section_text: Whoever commits dacoity shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
punishment: shall be punished with imprisonment for life,

section_text: Whoever causes death by doing an act with the intention of causing death, or with the intention of causing such bodily injury as is likely to cause death, or with the knowledge that he is likely by such act to cause death, commits the offence of culpable homicide.
chapter: OF OFFENCES AFFECTING THE HUMAN BODY
searchable_text: 299 culpable homicide whoever causes death by doing an act with the intention of causing death, or with the intention of causing such bodily injury as is likely to cause death, or with the knowledge that he is likely by such act to cause death, commits the offence of culpable homicide. indian penal code ipc

section_text: Except in the cases hereinafter excepted, culpable homicide is murder, if the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death.
chapter: OF OFFENCES AFFECTING THE HUMAN BODY
searchable_text: 300 murder except in the cases hereinafter excepted, culpable homicide is murder, if the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death. indian penal code ipc

section_text: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death, or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.
chapter: OF OFFENCES AFFECTING THE HUMAN BODY
searchable_text: 302 punishment for murder whoever commits murder shall be punished with death, or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine. indian penal code ipc

section_title: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder
section_text: Whoever commits culpable homicide not amounting to murder shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine, if the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death, or of causing such bodily injury as is likely to cause death.
chapter: OF OFFENCES AFFECTING THE HUMAN BODY
punishment: shall be punished with imprisonment for life,

section_text: Whoever does any act with such intention or knowledge, and under such circumstances that, if he by that act caused death, he would be guilty of murder, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if hurt is caused to any person by such act, the offender shall be liable either to imprisonment for life, or to such punishment as is hereinbefore mentioned.
